timeline.bodyText:
this can't be correct?

  
    
      
        Suggested change
        
          
    

        
      
    
    
      
          
            
                            "(cast((id/1000.0 - ?) / SECONDS_PER_DAY.0 as int))/? as day," +
          
          
            
                            "(cast((id/1000.0 - ?) / " + SECONDS_PER_DAY + " as int))/? as day," +
timeline.author: mikehardy
mikehardy

replies.bodyText:
why don't we get typed query ? I'd love typed queries.
Thanks
replies.author: Arthur-Milchior

timeline.bodyText: I had to read this to verify the what/why https://www.sqlite.org/lang_expr.html - seems legit
timeline.author: mikehardy

replies.bodyText: The query is literally the same here.
replies.author: Arthur-Milchior

replies.bodyText: it definitely is, I just had never considered SQL (or perhaps sqlite specifically) had casting semantics and wanted to satisfy the curiosity - is it still needed? how's it work?
replies.author: mikehardy

timeline.message:
NF: getNSecsPerDay removed

This does not add readability over SECONDS_PER_DAY

NF: getNSecsPerDay removed

This does not add readability over SECONDS_PER_DAY

NF: getNSecsPerDay removed

This does not add readability over SECONDS_PER_DAY
